Caustic

Caustic
IJSonObj

Defines an interface to our basic JSON object returned by the parser.

Module

import Parsers.JSon.IJsonParser

Functions
AddElement
virtual void AddElement(
IJSonObj* 
pValue
) = 0

Adds a child element to this element (assumes it is either a map or array object)

Parameters
pValue
IJSonObj*

value to add

GetName
virtual std::string GetName() = 0

Returns the name of the object

GetType
virtual CJSonType GetType() = 0

Returns type of the JSON object

GetValue
virtual std::any GetValue() = 0

Returns the value of the JSON object

FindObj
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> FindObj(
IJSonObj* 
pRootObj,
std::
string 
nameToFind
) = 0

Walks the JSon document starting at the specified root in search of the node specified by 'nameToFind'. 'nameToFind' should use the path format "name/subname/...".

Parameters
pRootObj
IJSonObj*

root of source to search

nameToFind
std::string

path of object to find

FindValue_String
virtual std::string FindValue_String(
std::
string 
name
) = 0

Searches the JSON DOM in search of the specified object and returns that object's value, which is expected to be a string

Parameters
name
std::string

name of object path to find

IJSonParser

Defines an interface for parsing JSON files.

Module

import Parsers.JSon.IJsonParser

Functions
LoadDOM
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> LoadDOM(
std::
wstring& 
fn
) = 0

Loads the Document object model from the specified JSON file

Parameters
fn
std::wstring&

name of file from which to read

SaveDOM
virtual void SaveDOM(
CRefObj<IJSonObj>& 
dom,
std::
wstring& 
fn
) = 0

Saves the Document object model (DOM) to the specified JSON file

Parameters
dom
CRefObj<IJSonObj>&

our JSON tree

fn
std::wstring&

name of file to write to

ReadDOM
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> ReadDOM(
const 
char* 
pBuffer
) = 0

Reads a JSON tree from the specified null terminated string buffer

Parameters
pBuffer
const char*

buffer that contains JSON data

Returns

A JSON Document object model (DOM)

WriteDOM
virtual uint32_t WriteDOM(
CRefObj<IJSonObj>& 
dom,
char* 
pBuffer,
uint32_t 
bufLen
) = 0

Writes a JSON tree to the specified buffer. To determine how big the buffer must be to contain the JSON text, you may call this method with a nullptr for 'pBuffer' and it will return the number of characters the buffer requires.

Parameters
dom
CRefObj<IJSonObj>&

JSON tree to write

pBuffer
char*

buffer to write to. Maybe nullptr, in which case the method returns the required size of the buffer in characters.

bufLen
uint32_t

length of buffer

Returns

Number of characters written
